documents.title: Bug Triage Guidelines
documents.description: Guidelines for triaging and prioritizing bugs
documents.content:
# Bug Triage Guidelines

## Severity Levels

### Critical
- System crashes or data loss
- Security vulnerabilities
- Complete feature breakdown
- Affects all users

### High
- Major feature not working
- Significant performance issues
- Affects many users
- No reasonable workaround

### Medium
- Minor feature issues
- Cosmetic problems with functional impact
- Affects some users
- Workaround available

### Low
- Cosmetic issues
- Minor inconveniences
- Enhancement requests
- Affects few users

## Priority Levels

### P0 - Urgent
- Fix immediately
- Production is down
- Security breach

### P1 - High
- Fix within 24-48 hours
- Major functionality broken
- Many users affected

### P2 - Normal
- Fix within current sprint
- Standard bug fixes
- Moderate user impact

### P3 - Low
- Fix when convenient
- Nice-to-have fixes
- Minor improvements

## Triage Process

1. **Initial Review**
   - Verify bug reproduction
   - Check for duplicates
   - Assign severity and priority

2. **Assignment**
   - Assign to appropriate team member
   - Set target fix date
   - Add relevant labels/tags

3. **Tracking**
   - Update progress regularly
   - Communicate with stakeholders
   - Document resolution

## Bug States

- **Open:** Newly reported, needs review
- **Triaged:** Reviewed and prioritized
- **Assigned:** Assigned to developer
- **In Progress:** Being actively worked on
- **Needs Testing:** Fix ready for testing
- **Testing:** Being tested by QA
- **Resolved:** Fixed and tested
- **Closed:** Confirmed working in production
- **Rejected:** Not a bug or won't fix

documents.title: Bug Testing Checklist
documents.content:
# Bug Testing Checklist

## Pre-Testing
- [ ] Review original bug report
- [ ] Understand expected vs actual behavior
- [ ] Prepare test environment
- [ ] Gather necessary test data

## Functional Testing
- [ ] Verify bug is fixed in reported scenario
- [ ] Test related functionality
- [ ] Test edge cases
- [ ] Verify fix works across different browsers
- [ ] Test on different devices/screen sizes

## Regression Testing
- [ ] Verify fix doesn't break existing functionality
- [ ] Run relevant automated test suites
- [ ] Test integration points
- [ ] Check performance impact

## User Acceptance
- [ ] Test from user perspective
- [ ] Verify user workflow is not disrupted
- [ ] Check accessibility compliance
- [ ] Validate error handling

## Documentation
- [ ] Update test cases if needed
- [ ] Document test results
- [ ] Update user documentation
- [ ] Note any new test scenarios

## Sign-off
- [ ] QA approval
- [ ] Product owner approval (if needed)
- [ ] Ready for deployment

## Post-Deployment
- [ ] Monitor production metrics
- [ ] Watch for related issues
- [ ] Collect user feedback
- [ ] Close bug ticket
